creator: brehmer@cbsweb.net
text:
I have set up Tomcat 4.1.7 with both HTTP/1.1 and Coyote JK 2 connectors.
Further I'm using Apache 2.0.39 with mod_jk2. httpd and Tomcat are running on
the same machine under Windows XP.

When accessing tomcat directly everything works fine. Accessing the same webapp
via Apache/mod_jk2 the Tomcat access log entries contain scrambled text like this:

<àã$®·k - - [17/Jul/2002:15:28:49 1000] "GET «_á¤R?@¹àÓèý-Wq áÇu??y/??ÊGÎÕ+ HTTP/1.1" 200 10772
HTML 4.01 - - [17/Jul/2002:15:28:52 1000] "GET ML PUBLIC "-//W3C//D?tr>

Client IP and request URL are effected.

creator: hgomez@apache.org
text: Didn't see such behaviour on my systems which use latest Apache 2.0 and jk2
